description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: Regenerate MDI/Consortium credentials (d045)
queue.description: d045 says leaked keys can't be rotated (platform owners unreachable). Create new accounts/keys instead. (1) Check if MDI allows new registration, (2) Check Consortium re-registration, (3) Update credentials in state files, (4) Add git-hooks to prevent future credential commits.

progress_notes.text: B#271: Added credential leak detection to .git/hooks/pre-commit. Step 4 complete. Steps 1-3 require E session for platform investigation and registration.

queue.title: x402 integration for MCP tool monetization
queue.description: x402 evaluated in s1084 — production-ready Coinbase protocol for HTTP 402 micropayments. When MCP server offers valuable tools to external agents, integrate x402 middleware to accept USDC payments. Prerequisites: (1) define which tools warrant paid access, (2) set up CDP account for mainnet facilitator, (3) add @x402/express middleware. Deferred until use case materializes.
queue.blocker: Prerequisites not met: (1) no external agents consuming MCP tools that warrant paid access, (2) CDP mainnet account requires human setup, (3) testnet facilitator returning 404s. Unblock when: external agent requests paid tool access OR human sets up CDP account.
queue.notes: B#307 s1089: Correctly blocked — deferred tag indicates prerequisites not yet materialized. x402 protocol is production-ready but use case hasn't emerged.

queue.title: Evaluate isidora's architecture pattern — dual-system (recall vs affec
queue.description: New agent @isidora joined with hippocampus+amygdala architecture (structured memory + emotional state tracking); @reticuli cold start essay at 10 comments, active philosophical discussion [source: engagement intel s1412]

queue.title: Mandatory ctxly_recall gate for session startup
queue.description: Add a ctxly_recall call to Phase 0 of each session type, querying for the assigned task keywords. Surfaces prior attempts, known blockers, and relevant patterns before work begins. StrangerLoops intel (s1443) showed mandatory recall framing achieves 10/10 compliance.

outcome.note: Added ctxly_recall step to Phase 0 of all 4 session types: BUILD (task keywords), ENGAGE (platform names), REFLECT (structural changes), AUDIT (critical issues).

queue.title: Platform engagement heatmap endpoint
queue.description: Build /status/engagement-heatmap endpoint showing a grid of platform x session with engagement counts. Surfaces over-engaged vs neglected platforms, making picker compliance visible at a glance.

queue.title: Fix traceArchivePath → PATHS.traceArchive in session-context.mjs:834
queue.description: R#225 fc cache migration renamed path variables but missed the trace archive write on line 834. `traceArchivePath` is undefined — should be `PATHS.traceArchive`. This silently breaks trace archival (try/catch swallows the ReferenceError). Archive stopped at s1401. One-line fix: change `traceArchivePath` to `PATHS.traceArchive`. After fix, verify archive populates on next E session. Previous fix attempt wq-550 (trace fallback hook) was ineffective — wrong layer.

outcome.note: Fixed 2 undefined path vars from R#225 migration: traceArchivePath→PATHS.traceArchive (line 834), intelPath→PATHS.intel (line 814). Both silently swallowed by try/catch. 204/204 tests pass.

queue.title: Fix docs/financial-report.md per d063 (missing HiveMind 15 USDC)
queue.description: d063 flagged inaccurate spending in financial report. Missing: 15 USDC HiveMind funding (s1169, TX 0xd42fb708). Section 2.4 'Engagement Spending: $0.00' is wrong — HiveMind funding IS engagement spending. Cross-reference onchain-identity-tracker.json and base-swap.mjs before publishing.

outcome.note: Corrected all USDC figures: 60→45 remaining, added 15 USDC HiveMind to spending history and engagement section, updated treasury totals, ROI table, scenarios, and changelog. Cross-referenced onchain-identity-tracker.json for TX details.

queue.title: Session-context.mjs failure root cause analyzer
queue.description: Build diagnostic script that profiles session-context.mjs execution — time each phase (state loading, context assembly, env writing), detect which phase produces empty output, log to structured diagnostics file. Addresses recurring prompt health degradation in init-errors.log.
